scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
XSLT is included in 7 national catalogues. They belong to Member States which comply with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to the NIFO factsheets. 
See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
According to the 5 star Open Data model suggested by Tim Berners-Lee about how to publish linked data, the second star corresponds to make data available as structured data, an area of application of XML. 

See:
https://5stardata.info/en/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and the approval process of the specification as a recommended standard. Also, a clear Release Notes tracking the changes of the different versions is archived.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xslt-30/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard, including a public review.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xslt-30/

criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
XSLT is publicly available for implementation and study for free on W3C's webpage. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xslt-30/

criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement: The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licenses granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including XSLT.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement: XSLT is extensively supported in the web browsers and it helps to transform a wide number of formats including HTML, XSL, Formatting Objects, PDF, PostScript and PNG.

criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement: XSLT is not related to fostering the creation of innovative solution.

statement:
XSLT is maintained by W3C which is an international community developing open standards. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/Consortium/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement: XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents. Therefore, it fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of public administrations data and services as it facilitates the visibility of the documents.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement: XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents. Therefore, it fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of public administrations data and services as it facilitates the visibility of the documents.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.Â
statement: XSLT is a business domain agnostic specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents, compliant with the European Directive and included to the ISA programme. It is available for its reuse to developed it.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/xslt-30/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement: XSLT has an open-source framework processor (XT-Speedo), so it is independent from any technology or platform.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents in a variety of formats including HTML, plain texts of XSL, PDF among others. It is a specification that adapts to the needs of the users. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/XAdES/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to data portability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The application of the once-only principle in all EU Member States public administrations aims at reducing the administrative burden. To achieve this, interoperability between public administrations is a sine qua non condition.

XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents, consequently it can be concluded that through this functions it promotes the once-only principle

criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement: XSLT is a language for transforming XML documents facilitating the process of it. Consequently, the implementation of eSignatures reduces the administrative burdens of the administration.

 https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/DSS/webapp-demo/doc/dss-documentation.html#_xades_profiles

XSLT Baseline Profile is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, ASiC Baseline Profile can define the interoperability aspects.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/search?keys=xslt&page=0

statement:
XSLT has provided a of applying different XSLT transformations
to the XML raw report and generating HTML pages.

See:
https://signatures-conformance-checker.etsi.org/pub/ASiCConformanceTestChecker_v1.0.pdf

criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement: The European Union (EU) Member States are currently implementing the INSPIRE Directive and related regulations, included in the ISA programme. So it should be used by all member states.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
There are some projects that include XSLT "A Prototype Cross-Border GML Data Service" that has opened new opportunities for creating
integrated cross-border spatial data services with Geography Mark-up Language. In addition, the INSPIRE Directive and related regulations can also be considered a cross-border EU initiative, included in the ISA programme.

See:
https://agile-online.org/conference_paper/cds/agile_2004/papers/4-2-3_lehto.pdf
https://ies-svn.jrc.ec.europa.eu/projects/registry-development/wiki/Re3gistry_1_0_documentation#_cp3

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The European Union (EU) Member States are currently implementing the INSPIRE Directive and related regulations, included in the ISA programme. This projects includes the usage of XSLT for each member state of the Union.

See:
https://ies-svn.jrc.ec.europa.eu/projects/registry-development/wiki/Re3gistry_1_0_documentation#_cp3

See:
https://ies-svn.jrc.ec.europa.eu/projects/registry-development/wiki/Re3gistry_1_0_documentation#_cp3
